message: yeah
Oh... No, not leah. Just someone who also notices tons of logins/outs
testing that theory now...

I think there will be a logout for each browser tab, device disconnect/timeout etc, also in some less than complete tests, it seems that even if you click logout on your account drop down, the logout itself doesn't occur until you close that browser window/tab
It is quite verbose, yes
lol
it's your logins and logouts that I was querying :-)
Who me?
is it just noisy or are you testing something in a way that blats your session a lot?
actually for some reason I thought that was @leah
and maybe explicitly after clicking 'logout' on the site, but not sure about that one
utter failure at paying attenting
or typing
@leah is all the login/logout noise just a fact of life or (specifically right now) are you doing something that makes it worse for your identity - seeing a heap of them for you right now
logouts occur after some timeout when a user doesn't reconnect to the "live" endpoint
Maybe the iPhone pings the live endpoint a bit too slowly as well?
Maybe ping a bit faster to avoid getting logged out?
The logout event occurs if you haven't pinged the live endpoint for 30 seconds
Although, if you're in a lot of groups you'll get lots of logged-in/out messages for other users...
@markpasc - what do you think?

@leah okay the 30 seconds is good to know. imho that's a bit aggressive compared to the x-live-frequency value. That frequency should be low enough (compared to logout timetou) that if my first request times-out, I can still avoid generating a logout on a second request.
Oh! I've been randomly checking convore on my iPhone today... Hence the logging in and out

that said, I'll probably treat login/logout as transient presence and only generate a real "logged out" notification (depending on prefs) X minutes after the last logout... something like that anyhow.
30 seconds is actually not quite correct, it's X-Live-Frequency * 1.5, so in this case 45 seconds
@ericflo thanks for the clarification wrt the relationship between timeout and live-frequency
it's a bit noisy but the initial hex before 'logout' shows that it's all the same operation instance and therefore the same request. Looks like I'm getting one logout per group.

yep, that's definitely it. I couldn't figure out why some users would generate multiple logouts in my live feed while others generated just one. It turns out to be that I get a logout for every group the user and I both belong to.
it's not a problem (for me) but I thought I'd bring it up in case it points to a problem. When I do my initial immediate live request after letting my login time-out, I get back this:

-[JPConvorePollOperation shouldFinishWithCompletedResponse:data:](0x6547c0) logout (1302276826.458388): protocool (1706)
-[JPConvorePollOperation shouldFinishWithCompletedResponse:data:](0x6547c0) logout (1302276826.473906): protocool (1706)
-[JPConvorePollOperation shouldFinishWithCompletedResponse:data:](0x6547c0) logout (1302276826.490916): protocool (1706)
-[JPConvorePollOperation shouldFinishWithCompletedResponse:data:](0x6547c0) logout (1302276826.521183): protocool (1706)
-[JPConvorePollOperation shouldFinishWithCompletedResponse:data:](0x6547c0) logout (1302276826.555456): protocool (1706)
-[JPConvorePollOperation shouldFinishWithCompletedResponse:data:](0x6547c0) logout (1302276826.605984): protocool (1706)
-[JPConvorePollOperation shouldFinishWithCompletedResponse:data:](0x6547c0) logout (1302276826.619752): protocool (1706)
